meanings.definition: The point on the Earth's surface directly above the focus of an earthquake.
meanings.sent1: During the earthquake, the epicentra was where the shaking was strongest.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the epicentra to understand seismic activity better.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was ruined when the epicentra of the earthquake caused all the food to spill.
meanings.sent4: In the chaos of the earthquake, the epicentra seemed like the heart of the disturbance.
meanings.sent5: The epicentra of the earthquake was like a bullseye on the Earth's surface.

meanings.definition: The central point of something, typically something negative or disruptive.
meanings.sent1: The epicentra of the argument was the misunderstanding between the two friends.
meanings.sent2: The epicentra of the storm brought heavy rain and strong winds.
meanings.sent3: The epicentra of the party was when the cake fell on the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her angry outburst was the epicentra of the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The epicentra of the problem was finally addressed and resolved.
